tweets.text: @BBCPanorama 1000s of lives in Newcastle Under Lyme have been seriously affected with now a stated risk to health as a landfill goes out of control with EA levels above WHO guidelines & permit breaches,  we are being gassed in our homes, investigate this monster on our doorstep! https://t.co/4I37pqQ3Ai
Huge mental health ticking time bomb here being largely ignored by @PHE_EoEngland & too little too late by @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @BBCNews @itvnews @JeremyVineOn5 https://t.co/Ys0u3pvEXC

@StinkStopthe It was so bad on Thursday 1/4/21 I had to pull over to throw up on my way to the supermarket. It is not safe to drive through the miasma, When I got to the supermarket, I was dizzy.  After this incident, I was ill for two days: vomiting, migraines, fatigue.

Why does the @EnvAgency promote these lies, last year on the @RiverChess we had 52 days when we had sewage discharges that had absolutely nothing to do with storm events. This year already we've had 70 days of sewage discharges that had absolutely nothing to do with storm events https://t.co/DiHw6dO6uY

According to WHO, exposure to Hydrogen Sulfide is seriously dangerous. https://t.co/YI4Lfek1FI. Are @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgencyMids just waiting for people to die? #StopTheStink https://t.co/FXKfkRgXal

@Chisholm4Trail @RosieP4 @AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @EnvAgency The problems are well understood by water companies, they may not yet be fully quantified and certainly there is insufficient funding to eradicate all the problems.

@Chisholm4Trail @RosieP4 @AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @EnvAgency Trueüëç Separate sewerage systems are constructed in new developments but often connect into existing combined systemsüôÑcombined systems are often culverted streams within urban areas. Infiltration through leaking pipe joints or land drainage connections in high water table areas.

@AaronBell4NUL @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL , I am truly aghast. I was certain that the odour nuisance guideline would be exceeded, but to hear that the health-based guidance is exceeded is truly astonishing. To think the residents of Newcastle were vilified for daring to complain, yet science backs them.

Bearing in mind that the 30-minute peak in the previous monitoring exercise was 44.5, it‚Äôs clear my constituents are being subjected to a major and ongoing environmental incident.

I trust the culprits will be properly held accountable by @EnvAgencyMids.
